meta.title: Technology FAQs for At-Home Learning - West Hartford Public Schools

meta.name: description
meta.content: Technology FAQs for At-Home Learning - West Hartford Public Schools

meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Technology FAQs for At-Home Learning, West Hartford Public Schools
Technology FAQs for At-Home Learning - West Hartford Public Schools
Technology FAQs for At-Home Learning - West Hartford Public Schools

body.class: fsLiveMode fsHasHeader fsHasMenu fsHasRightBanner fsHasFooter fsHasOneColumnLayout fsSection329 fsHasTheme2

li.a: Crisis Phone Numbers and Web Contacts
The Early Learning Center (ELC) Preschool Program
Pre-Kindergarten and Early Learning Center Family Handbook
Sixth Grade Curriculum in a Nutshell
Seventh Grade Curriculum in a Nutshell
Eighth Grade Curriculum in a Nutshell
Admin access to Elementary Report Cards
Administrative Guidelines for the Use of Technology
Statement Regarding the Use of Graphics on Web Sites and Blogs

div.a: Skip to Main Content

div.class: fsElement fsPostElement fsGrid fsThumbnailOriginal fsThumbnailSmall fsItemCount_0

img.alt: Parents - Add Apps to a WHPS Loaner iPad

div.a: Parents - Add Apps to a WHPS Loaner iPad

div.p: This resource will help you know how to access additional apps using Meraki for app management.

div.a: Teachers - Be the Last to Leave Your Google Meets Sessions

div.p: If you are a teacher of students in grades 3 through 8, you must be the last one to leave a Meets session!

div.a: Teachers - Google Classroom Feedback on Assignments

div.p: Personalized feedback for student work is easier and more important than ever through G-Suite tools!

div.a: Cyber Compass - Digital Citizenship

div.p: To make the most of the Internet, kids need to be prepared to make smart decisions.

div.a: G-Suite Tools and At-Home Learning

div.p: Check out some resources to help implement at-home learning!

div.a: Translate the Language of a Google Doc

div.p: You can translate documents intoÂ many languagesÂ withÂ Google Docs.

div.a: Scan Documents on an iPhone or iPad

div.p: Using the Notes app on an iPhone or iPad, you can scan documents and add a signature or manually sign a document.

div.a: Upload iPhone Photo/Video to Drive

div.p: Transfer photos and videos from an iPhone to Google Drive so you can share them with colleagues, students, or families.

div.a: Teachers - Keyboard Shortcuts for Time and Date Stamps in Google Sheets

div.p: You may want to quickly insert a timestamp in Google Sheets to mark activity.Â

div.a: Getting into Your Google Classroom

div.p: If you are not seeing your childâs classes in Google Classroom it might be due to multiple Google accounts being signed into the web browser.

div.a: Parents - Connect a Chromebook to Home Wi-Fi

div.p: Step-by-step instructions for connecting to a Chromebook to wifi at home.

div.a: Parents - Connect an iPad to Home Wi-Fi

div.p: Step-by-step instructions for connecting an iPadÂ to wifi at home.

div.a: Teachers - Helpdesks Requests Online

div.p: Making Helpdesk requestsÂ onlineÂ is preferred because it is faster and more efficient than contacting Helpdesk through emailÂ or phone.

div.a: Parents - Accessing Technology and Internet at Home

div.p: Here are some options for you to check out.

div.a: Parents - Device FAQs for Online Learning

div.p: A key ingredient to the success of this plan is student access to a device

div.a: Teachers - Google Classroom Overview (opens in new window/tab)

div.p: Google Classroom basics for teachers

div.a: Teachers - How to Create your First Google Classroom (opens in new window/tab)

div.p: Google Classroom makes teaching more efficient and meaningful by giving educators a hub for student assignments, boosting student collaboration, and fostering communication.

div.a: Helpdesk for Parents

div.p: Helpdesk@whps.orgÂ or 860-561-6636

div.a: WHPS Voicemail & Call Forwarding

div.p: Stay connected to important messages.

div.a: Google Hangouts Meet

div.p: Learn these basics to get started with Hangouts Meet.

div.a: Add Email to Your Mobile Device

div.p: Access your email when you're away from your desk.

div.a: Auto-grade a Quiz with Google Forms

div.p: It's now easier than ever to auto-score quizzes and get immediate feedback to students!

div.a: Google Calendar Daily Email

div.p: One of the many options you can set through the Notifications tab is to be emailed at 5am each day with a schedule of meetings and tasks.Â

div.a: How to enlarge a web page

div.p: If you have difficulty reading web pages because the text is too small, itâs very easy to âZoom inâ and make the whole page bigger.

div.a: How to See Your Gmail Groups

div.p: You can use Groups to create email lists to easily send email, or share files and calendars with larger groups.

div.a: Connect to WIFI From Your Phone

div.p: Connect to the public wifi network: whps_wifi

div.a: Rotate Text and more in Google Sheets

div.p: This is especially useful when you need to fit long header names into thin columns, or when you simply want to fit more text on a single screen.

div.a: Changing Your Gmail Password

div.p: If you clicked on a link in a compromised email please reset your password!

div.a: Cyber Safety

div.p: Protect yourself and your devices.

li.a: Crisis Phone Numbers and Web Contacts

div.p: Our Mission is to inspire and prepare all students to realize their potential and enhance our global community.Â
Â
Our schools are a tapestry of cultures and ethnicities, with over 70 languages represented in our school system, a microcosm of all the talent, intelligence, and diversity that America has to offer.

p.span: The teachers, administrators, and support staff of the West Hartford Public Schools are driven by ourÂ Mission Framework and District GoalsÂ to ensure that our students experience high expectations, dynamic teaching, and a rigorous and relevant curriculum.Tom Moore

div.p: Â

div.div: 50 South Main St, West Hartford, CT 06107
